title: Gallery Talk: A Peek at Porcelain
hero_caption: Jeff Koons. Woman in Tub, 1988. Collection of Stefan T. Edlis and H. Gael Neeson, partial and promised gift to the Art Institute of Chicago.
description:
What do a 12th-century Chinese incense burner and Jeff Koons’ Woman in Tub (1988) have in common? The medium of porcelain. Slip into the breathtaking world of porcelain with educator Alexis Culotta and visit some of the museum’s most splendid examples from across history and around the world. Works included will highlight some of history’s most iconic makers and the incredible innovations they added to the field. 

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an e-mail to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
